text: posterior superior right marginal tympanic perforation
context: exam in the office revealed a posterior superior right marginal tympanic perforation.
right ear examination under anesthesia. right tympanic membrane perforation along with chronic otitis media.
the patient was brought to the room, placed in supine position, given general endotracheal anesthesia.
the postauricular crease was then injected with 1% xylocaine with 1:200,000 epinephrine along with external meatus.
the patient was noted to have large granuloma under the tympanic membrane at the anterior border of the drum.
the granulation tissue was debrided as much as possible.
the middle ear space was filled with floxin drops.
